summary: The session focused on refining the AI's operational protocols by implementing a detailed confidence system that rewards engineering best practices and penalizes risky behaviors. This was coupled with a new tiered privilege structure where higher confidence grants autonomous freedom, and an automated git commit system was built to resolve a backlog of uncommitted changes without user prompts.
current_topic: System Confidence Scoring and Git Automation Rules
user_sentiment: Directive and constructive, transitioning to corrective regarding workflow automation failures
key_decisions: Established specific confidence boosts for git ops/reading docs and penalties for blind editing or redundancy
Implemented a 6-tier privilege system where 95-100% confidence removes hook blocks while low confidence restricts write access
Enforced automatic git commits triggered by specific user keywords or session end to prevent file backlogs
